metadata.title: CVE-2016-10200 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Race condition in the L2TPv3 IP Encapsulation feature in the Linux kernelbefore 4.8.14 allows local users to gain privileges or cause a denial ofservice (use-after-free) by making multiple bind system calls withoutproperly ascertaining whether a socket has the SOCK_ZAPPED status, relatedto net/l2tp/l2tp_ip.c and net/l2tp/l2tp_ip6.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10200` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-62-generic - 4.4.0-62.83
linux-image-4.4.0-62-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-62.83
linux-image-4.4.0-62-lowlatency - 4.4.0-62.83
linux-image-4.4.0-62-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-62.83
linux-image-4.4.0-62-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-62.83
linux-image-4.4.0-62-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-62.83
linux-image-4.4.0-62-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-62.83
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-62-generic - 4.4.0-62.83
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1042-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1042.49
No subscription required

linux-image-4.8.0-39-lowlatency - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.8.0-39-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3

No subscription required

linux-image-extra-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-62.83').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1042.49').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1046.50').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.12').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1').
linux-gke package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
linux-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
linux-gcp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1004.4').

linux-euclid package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-9019.20').
linux-oem package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1008.9').
